bdglue2.encoder

Class EventQueue<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • bdglue2.encoder.EventQueue<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of data we are handling in the queue

    public class EventQueue<T>
extends Object
    A class that manages a queue of events for processing. It leverages a BlockingQueue to do that.

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int encoderInputQueueSize

    • Constructor Detail

      • EventQueue

        public EventQueue(String name,
                  int size)
        Create a queue for managing EventData.

        This is a wrapper around an instance of BlockingQueue to make it easier to collect statistics.

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the queue
        size - the size / depth of the queue

    • Method Detail

      • put

        public void put(T evt)
         throws InterruptedException
        Put an event on this queue.
        Parameters:
        evt - the event we are putting on the queue
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if interrupted while waiting to put data on the queue

      • take

        public T take()
       throws InterruptedException
        Take an event off of this queue.

        This call will block and wait for data if there is nothing on the queue.

        Returns:
        the event at the head of the queue.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if interrupted while waiting for data to take from the queue

      • peek

        public T peek()
        Peek at the object at the head of the queue.

        This call is similar to take except that it does not block and the returned object is not removed from the queue.

        Returns:
        the object at the head of the queue, null otherwise.

      • size

        public int size()
        Returns:
        the number of objects currently in the queue.

      • drainTo

        public int drainTo(Collection<T> collection)
        Drain the queue to the specified collection. This may be more efficient than "taking" one element from the queue at a time. Note that this does not block and will return 0 if the queue is empty.
        Parameters:
        collection - the java.util.Collection to drain the queued elements to.
        Returns:
        the number of elements transferred

      • status

        public String status()
        Return the status of this queue formatted as a String. It contains information to help make determinations on whether the the queue should be larger, or more threads might be required, etc.
        Returns:
        the status of this queue as a String
